snippet: Far from candidates’ spotlights, hundreds of aides and volunteers are waging an unglamorous ground war unfolding with hidden intensity.
abstract: Hundreds of campaign staff members, aides and volunteers are waging an unglamorous ground war that will largely determine the outcome of the Republican presidential caucuses in Iowa; in the closing hours before the caucuses, the tedious and time-consuming work of identifying voters and persuading them to show up at the caucuses could make the difference among Republican who cannot seem to make up their minds.

byline.original: By A. G. SULZBERGER and MICHAEL BARBARO

lead_paragraph: Far from candidates’ spotlights, hundreds of aides and volunteers are waging an unglamorous ground war unfolding with hidden intensity.

headline.seo: Republicans Wage Hidden Ground War in Iowa
headline.main: Over Phones and Greasy Pizza, a Battle for Iowa
headline.print_headline: Over Phones and Greasy Pizza, a Battle for Iowa
